intro: Trouettia lissophylla var. pedicellata, commonly known as the slender-leaved Trouettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and requires partial to full sunlight. This variant is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and as a specimen plant.
